channel.title: Vista computer help?
channel.description:
ok i got this shitty computer cause i was sick of sharing a comp with the family.. well now i have done my classpath varubles and stuff and downloaded jdk well now when i open runserver.bat it opens for like 2 seconds and then closes....
ok my other problem is i cant get my no ip to work!! i used to have it so that i could log in with the ip of my no-ip and it would let me in then no one else though so then i port forwarded it started working i could log in with it and other people could and then someone crashed my server ever since then my no-ip has not worked i have tried making a new no-ip and new names for my server and a whole new server and everything nothing is working for no-ip anymore i am thinking of going back to hamachi >=[ :mad: so please help me i can not even log in with using my no-ip adress i have to use blank ip

item.title: Vista computer help?
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

It doesn’t matter this topic should of been locked already, if anyone even glances at the rules then they should know why before they even get inside this topic

2) We will not help with computer problems, ie: portforwarding, how to set up java and such. Use google or our Tutorial Section.

ok my other problem is i cant get my no ip to work!! i used to have it so that i could log in with the ip of my no-ip and it would let me in then no one else though so then i port forwarded it started working i could log in with it and other people could and then someone crashed my server ever since then my no-ip has not worked i have tried making a new no-ip and new names for my server and a whole new server and everything nothing is working for no-ip anymore i am thinking of going back to hamachi >=[ :mad: so please help me i can not even log in with using my no-ip adress i have to use blank ip[/quote]

Ooooh, vista…time for a downgrade don’t you think?

item.title: Vista computer help?
item.dc:creator: @Scully Scully
item.description:
@Scully wrote:

k i have downloaded jdk 1.6.0_10 and now what do i do? cause when i click runserver.bat it still goes for a millisecond and then closes............. oh and i took a screan shot 2 see what it said and it said javac could not be recognized as an internal or external command........................... -.x and i have tried making a new no-ip and i tried EVERYTHIN remember that i used to have it working.. its just one day a spammer flooded my server and my n-ip has nto worked since then and i have got new servers and everything even a new computer

Try adding these in Environment Variables, under user variables.
CLASSPATH
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;

Javac
C:\Program Files\Javac\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;

Read full topic

item.description:

Read full topic

item.title: Vista computer help?
item.dc:creator: @Scully Scully
item.description:
@Scully wrote:

yea. download the jdk update 6.10 offline installation and save it to your desktop. after it's done open it on your desktop and install.. that's exactly what i did.

Did that at my dad’s like 7 months ago and it worked fine, trying it on my new computer and it works as though it never happened before, or just not at all.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Scully Scully

@Scully wrote:

then click start => my comp => program files => java

It’s windows vista it doesn’t work that way with finding it. On vista there’s no way to find anything easily.

Read full topic

item.title: Vista computer help?
item.dc:creator: @superxero superxero
item.description:
@superxero wrote:

right click ure bat file, click edit
find the java settings… it’l be like…
\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin
err somtin like that…
then click start => my comp => program files => java
Locate ure java jdk, right click it, rename, copy whats there (DONT REALLY RENAME IT!)
go back to ure bat. edit text document and find the java thing again,
delete the existing java thing just the “jdk1.6.0_07” part
then paste ure new.
Hope it helps?

for the no-ip thing,
i suggest making a new ip, checking all ure settings, then tryin to run it. (firewall exeptions)

Read full topic
